Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bvanzett
Reviews.Content: Good location right on the door stop of the train/ metro station. Clean and well presented but don't expect much room to move. Balconys looking over the street/ station were very nice. Quite(ish) street since its in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, clean hotel with excellent central location”
Reviews.Author: refza
Reviews.Content: The Palym is located very near to the Gare de Lyon station where one can catch a train to Charles de Gaul airport or get on the metro. Also within a few blocks walk of Notre Dame and the river. The rooms are modest, but well kept and comfortable and above all the price won't leave you wishing you'd gone somewhere else. This is a great option for individuals, families or couples who are going to spend a few days exploring Paris and don't intend on spending a lot of time in their hotel room and are simply using it as a base of operations. There are a number of nearby pattisieries on the street where one can get breakfast too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and worth its price”
Reviews.Author: EMJ_Sweden
Reviews.Content: The hotel is placed 2min walking from train station Gare de lyon which makes it very easy to access from airport, saving money for taxi. Additionally hence it close location to Gare de lyon you also have easy access to the subway system. The hotel itself has normal rooms with bed and a msall bath room. Myself values accessability and price before the standard, and from that the hotel is very price worth. The staff was very friendly, and the hotel also had free wifi. In the close area around you have several restaurants with different price ranges.

Reviews.Title: “Old Building but Quality Facilities.”
Reviews.Author: Shalli
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends in end Oct 2011. Old building (this is common in Paris) but there are many restaurants/ cafe located from the hotel. Very basic breakfast items from the breakfast table and these are about the same very where in Paris. Was disappointed that there are no balcony at the hotel and it would be great if you could sit under the shade overlooking the Gare de Lyon station.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: sushsi
Reviews.Content: Spacious room for a family of 4. Clean room and despite getting a room facing the street, it was surprisingly quiet. The staff were great. Speaks good England and very helpful. Breakfast was basic but with many eateries around it was not a problem. Very near to the train station. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a solo traveler”
Reviews.Author: patanddil
Reviews.Content: Traveling alone and found everything needed in walking distance. Also transportation several minutes out the front door of the hotel - bus to aiport, train station and metro. Will go back.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: mandyryan
Reviews.Content: really enjoyed my stay here with my daughter and my friend. Nice rooms, clean, nice staff. Breakfast was only ok though. Location was great just around the corner from the station so perfect for getting to Disneyland. Would definetley reccomend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: 169owls
Reviews.Content: I would classify Hotel Palym as a great 2-star hotel. It was clean and had a great location but it was missing some things I would expect from a good hotel, things like shampoo in the shower and a clock/alarm. The towels were also somewhat coarse. Otherwise I have no complaints. The room was nice and quiet, Gare de Lyon was right across the street making it very easy to access anything in the city. It is also a 30 second walk from the pick up and drop off the Air France bus from CDG.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Gare de Lyon”
Reviews.Author: Atchara C
Reviews.Content: I travel with 2 childs, I choose this hotel because it close to Gare de Lyon. Conveniance to travel with metro, RER and TGV by walk from the station to hotel on 3 minutes. There are 24 hours staff, speak english well. Room is cleanliness and good smell. I checked in before check-in time, I can deposit the luggage in luggage room but the room was not locked.

Reviews.Title: “A bit above "just average"”
Reviews.Author: kersan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palym for my last night in Paris. The first piont that I must make is the staff all spoke very good English, were friendly and eager to be helpful. That makes for a good start in any Hotel. I was a bit disappointed with the rooom. Very small and the bed was a very small double (not much bigger than a single) and the pillows were terribly thin. However, I still managed a good night's sleep. The one really shining plus for this Hotel was that this 2 star Hotel had air conditioning and it actually worked. Quite a surprise after staying in the nearby ultra expensive Pullman Paris Bercy with Insight Vacations bus tour where neither the telephone nor the airconditioning worked! Considering the room rates here, this Hotel is not too bad, a bit above "just average".

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for travellers”
Reviews.Author: EDD1950
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here because of its convenience for Gare de Lyon and we will certainly use it again. Rooms are not large but clean. Breakfast is available from 7.00 am so great if you have an early train to catch. Check-in very smooth. We had a room at the front this time so had a great view of the station area, but our last room at the back was equally good. Price has gone up quite a bit since last year but still good value for its location. Lots of restaurants within a 5 minute walk. Very busy are but that makes for a great atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: awp2005
Reviews.Content: Not bad at all, the room is surprisingly spacious and very clean. I got king bed and still have plenty of room to move around. The immediate area is busy but very safe, no worry walking after midnight, the staff are nice and helpful. Metro and buses only a step away. Recommended for seasoned traveler, not recommended for the one who want to walk to every major sight seeing points.

Reviews.Title: “Great/Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suekapec
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Paris last week and needed a convenient hotel for two nights near Gare de Lyon train station. I found Hotel Palym and it was rated an 8.2 out of 10 on a Paris hotels website. I decided to try it out. The hotel employees were all wonderful and spoke English. The room was comfortable and very clean. It did smell a bit of cigarette smoke, but most hotels do in Europe. We opened the windows to reduce the smell. I would highly recommend this hotel. Close to the train station, 1-1/2 blocks from the Air France bus stop from the airport. It has many fine outdoor cafes and restaurants in the area and also close to the metro. They offer a breakfast for 8 Euros each morning, but we opted to eat out. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would use this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: Tracy J
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its close proximity to Gare de Lyon train station. Hotel was very clean, staff were very friendly and helpful. Family room was adequate for our 2 night stay, although not the largest of rooms. No English TV channels. We didn't take breakfast at the hotel (extra cost) as there are numerous cafe bars just minutes walk away. We would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: ilko1959
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in that hotel for few nights and really enjoyed staying there. The hotel is located in few hundreds feet from Gare de Lyon (Train Station). Also, another train station Gare d'Austerlitz is located in walking distance from the hotel. The Place de Bastille is also in walking distance. Lot of restaurants around. Two convenient stores nearby offer good selection of food and bottled water. Easy transportation all over entire Paris as well as entire France. The room was clean and staff is very friendly. Everyone was speaking English, so we did not experience any language difficulties. The hotel offers free WiFi internet although it was not functioning in rooms. However, it was working downstairs in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Save $”
Reviews.Author: JayMemphis
Reviews.Content: Excellent 2 star in this area of Paris. Clean. Helpful staff. Near metro and Gare de Lyon. With the dollar a hotel to consider if one wants a simple hotel to sleep in. Room size and shower more then adequate for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great position and good value”
Reviews.Author: MakingBubbles
Reviews.Content: We had a triple room on the first floor, just for one night. The room was comfortable and clean with a large double bed and a single. It is very close to the Gare du Lyon, just over the road in fact! The staff were helpful and we were able to leave our bags here for the day while we went site seeing, free of charge. The buffet breakfast was good value. There wasn't much street noise, but you could hear some noises from within the hotel, particularly the banging of the firedoors. We thought it was good value for money and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, simple, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ipoga
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palym has an excellent location right next to Gare de Lyon, making it easy to use public transportation, but still so close to the city centre that you can easily reach the latin quarter, montmartre, Louvre etc. by foot. Our room was decent and clean, with a romantic touch, but not something fantastic - so it matches the price well. The room is surprisingly quiet given the surrounding areas, which are quite noisy, due to heavy trafic, lots of cafées and general street life. Staff was friendly and spoke english, but use of hotel safes had to be paid separately. We really can't recommend the breakfast which was too sparse in selection. Better breakfasts can be found at the surrounding cafées.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Gare De Lyon”
Reviews.Author: LuciaAnna
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in Palym Hotel. Very close to Gare de Lyon Station which was perfect as we had an early start to Milan. Small,friendly and clean. Just what we wanted

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aisha A
Reviews.Content: this hotel is rated as 2 stars hotel but i think it is butter than this it may reach 3.5 stars. the rooms are big and airconditioned, the toilit needs update. it is close to gare de lyon station and metro ,so it is very conviniant to reach every where by metro.

Reviews.Title: “Next to Gare de Lyon but somehow peaceful...”
Reviews.Author: Bluemoon52
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel becuase we had an early start on the TGV to Nice from the Gare de Lyon, so it was its nearness to the station that prompted the booking. But, especially for a hotel that must have a lot of travellers passing through, it really was a nice place. A huge room (by Paris standards) with a great view across to the station clock. Staff were friendly and welcoming and everything was clean and well presented. We walked about ten minutes to the Bastille/Marais where there are lots of good places to eat and drink - but there are cafes and restaurants much nearer if you don't fancy a stroll. Would recommend it both for where it is and for being good value and a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: ProfRS
Reviews.Content: We initially booked this hotel for convenience and value - it had good rates and was very close to the Gare de Lyon, which offers great access to the metro, RER local trains, the TGV and other long-distance trains. But, despite it's plain exterior, the interior of the hotel truly impressed us even if we were to ignore the location and value. The rooms were comfortable and elegant, the entire space was well-appointed, and the services provided at the hotel were first-rate. We stayed with somewhat older children (aged 11, 10 & 9) who occupied a room by themselves, while we had an adjacent room - it worked out very well. We would definitely go back there!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: annamariaisland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the metro / RER Station Gare de Lyon - only 3 min walking distance. In a calm street without outside noise. The rooms are as most in Paris clairaudient. There is not much extras (no minibar, no caffeemaker) but for the price (below Eur 100.00) you should not expect the same you get in the US otherwise you have to pay close the double! The bed was large and comfortable. The bathroom on the small side but ok. I stayed several times in the hotel and the staff is always friendly, for sure also an advantage when you talk their language but they do their best to understand and help you. So if you are looking for a cheap hotel this is the one to go

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Gare de Lyon”
Reviews.Author: EDD1950
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before travelling on to Italy. By far the best hotel we have found near the station. Staff very helpful and breakfast, though basic, was ready when we needed it for our early departure. We will definitely use the Palym again

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good service”
Reviews.Author: Ann1613
Reviews.Content: I, my twin and our mother stayed at Palym for five nights. The triple room we had was spacious and even had a bathtub. The cream-colored and newish decoration wasn't too personal but didn't hurt the aesthetic eye either. We had requested a room with a view to Gare de Lyon, and that was what we were given. The room was well insulated, so there was no noise from the surrounding rooms and not much from the outside either. There is a supermarket called Monop just around the corner and a few good restaurants to eat. We ate the 8 € hotel breakfast a couple of times, which was decent enough but would be better of with something salty in it. The rest of the days we just bought something from one of the close-by bakeries. The staff was great and did their best to understand our lacking French. The overall experience was good and the price of the room was very reasonable in Paris standards.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Budget Hotel, Excellent Location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: wanderingcanuks
Reviews.Content: Hotel's location is excellent, across from Gare de Lyon, right at the metro stop. Very clean and comfortable hotel, comfortable beds and good showers. The bus to Charles de Gaulle Airport is across from the hotel and every 30 min. Very convenient location for a lot of sight-seeing in Paris. Great restaurants and cafes around and very near the hotel. Breakfast as now is 8 Euros/person, Continental and with great croissants baked fresh every morning. There is butter and packs of different jams. We would have prefered more choice such as cheese in breakfast, and we were willing to pay more for it. Also, it would be great if guests can control the room temperatures, rather than controlled centrally. We found the rooms a bit warm and preferred it cooler. However, it is a great hotel, clean and comfortable, in great location with great rates. Recommend to other travellers and will stay there again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Small but cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: sgalexang
Reviews.Content: I have booked a double room at Palym Hotel based on 3 reasons; 1. The reviews at Tripadvisor 2. Close to Gare de Lyon Station as I am departing for Milan via Artesia train 3. Price of 105 Euro/ night We stayed 2 nights in April and we liked it! The room is small but the decor and coziness make up for it. The bed is nice too. The 3 reception staffs that we met during our stay are extremely helpful and can converse well in English (We can't speak any French beside Bonjour and Merci). The street is quiet at night which ensure a good rest and the Free Wifi in the room is just great! With Gare de Lyon Station just across the street, all attractions can be reach shortly with the Metro. The only cons that I can think of are the small bathroom (expected though) and no free breakfast (Need to pay additional 8 Euros per pax). End of the day, we will stay here again for the same 3 reasons. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Fair and close to Gare de Lyon”
Reviews.Author: ferfox
Reviews.Content: Hotel Palym is very well located, just a few steps from Gare de Lyon. This means trains and Metro system very very close. You can also go to Bastille or even Notredame by foot. With energy, even the Louvre is reachable by foot. Positive: Well Located (it is in a small street), Clean, Fair rates, FREE WI-FI :) Negative: Poor breakfast, just bread and yorgut (and croissant) some fruit and ham would help....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: cheerychappie
Reviews.Content: My father and I stayed here for one night. We were in single rooms which were very small but clean, comfortable and perfectly adequate for a one night stop. Road surprisingly quiet given that I could see the Gare de Lyon at the end of the street. A 30 min pleasant stroll by the river to Notre Dame. Staff helpful and so useful to be able to leave luggage the following morning until time to catch the TGV. Self-service breakfast fine - public rooms very nicely decorated and comfortable. Lift useful as was wireless access. Would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: MikefromMelbourn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Palym for one night on the 2nd January primarily because of its location for a meeting I had the next day and its highly competitive rates. The hotel was clean, the room compact but comfortable, the en suite also compact but modern and everything worked. The staff were friendly and breakfast was standard “croissant and coffee” fayre served from 7.00am for an extra €7.50 which compared well with the €16 charged by café’s nearby. The hotel is just a stone’s throw from Gare de Lyon for those catching an early morning train South and from where you can also readily connect to a multitude of Metro and Regional rail lines for travel anywhere else in Paris and the environs. The Gare d'Austerlitz is also just a few minutes’ walk away across the Pont Charles de Gaulle on the other side of the river Seine. The streets immediately around the Hotel sport a concentration of lively restaurants including the well regarded Brasserie L'Europeen. Hotel Palym is typical of a Paris 2 star. The 2 star standard can mean different things around Europe, in Paris it means functional and no-frills but you can still expect courteous, clean and comfortable and on these points Palym checked the boxes.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every cent.”
Reviews.Author: larany27
Reviews.Content: The proximity to Gare de Lyon was ideal. Everything was explained in detail at reception. The rooms were small, which was expected, but always cleaned. I was concerned if they would question us if we brought in our own breakfast, but that didn't happen. The staff was always friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, cheap, clean one block (100m) from Gare de Lyon”
Reviews.Author: FrancoisP
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night between arrival from USA and taking TGV the next day. You can see the railroad station from the doorway. Pleasant 24 hour front desk people. Good-sized, clean room for two with nice, large bath/WC. Wi-fi for a fee. Price of €85 excellent value. Breakfast included, but nothing special. Special value for business travel, but comfortable enough for vacationers. Highly recommended. Among the best values experienced in 15 years of travel to France.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: AdventureTraveler63
Reviews.Content: Great location near the Gare de Lyon TGV station. Small room (naturally) but very clean. BIg plus - the hotel has an elevator! Walk along the Seine or take the Batobus to all major attractions. Under 100 euros for double room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Tim_Norway
Reviews.Content: A very cheap hotel within GREAT reach of the metro & trains! The airport express bus stops literaly 3 minutes walk from the hotel! The hotel was quiet, clean, spacious room, wonderful balcony, very helpful service! Will stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: heatherclaire93
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for the money. The location can't be beat. It's literally a 3 minute walk to Gare de Lyon (Metro station and also has trains to other cities in France) and also within walking distance of the Bastille. Plenty of restaraunts and shops around to explore. The room was clean. We got a quadruple that slept 4 comfortably. The only negatives were that there weren't any dresser to put clothes in and the bathroom was really small. Also, you can probably get a better breakfast outside for the same money they charge for the croissants and coffee at their continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money in paris”
Reviews.Author: rome-weary
Reviews.Content: good hotel accross from gare de lyon, spacious rooms, spotlessly clean, best access to public transport, for breakfast croissant and coffee go to one of many cafés & brasseries at your doorstep, maybe not the ultimate chic, but great value for the traveller who does not want luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: unasola
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights at this hotel, one week apart. I chose this hotel specifically because of its proximity to the Gare de Lyon. First night I had an early morning train to catch. Second night I had a late night train arrival. First night was fine. Room was a bit more shabby that website photos showed and the bathroom was tiny but room was clean and comfortable and suitable for one night. When I turned up at 11.30pm on the second night with my confirmed booking in hand, along with the fax I had sent advising of my arrival time, I was told that the hotel was full. The man on the desk offered no apology or explanation, only told me that "there was a problem". He had booked me into another hotel which he said wasn't far and gave me a map. I told him there was no way I was walking there at that time of night on my own and asked him to call a taxi which he did. The other hotel was horrible and I wouldn't have felt comfortable staying there so I walked out. Thanks to a very helpful receptionist in the Mercure I managed to get a room in the Pullman Bercy. Way over my usual budget but worth every penny just for the feeling of security.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location for early TGV depafrture”
Reviews.Author: amcl9386
Reviews.Content: The size and cleanliness of the room was better than any we had previously experienced in Paris. We only stayed one night and had an early morning departure from Gare de Lyon. The short walk from the hotel to the station was very convenient. Only regret was that we didn't have more try to explore in and around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay and great location”
Reviews.Author: mkb952
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights and found the hotel to be very clean and comfortable. Can't respond on the breakfast as we ate at some restaurants nearby for nearly the same amount of money. Within walking distance of Notre Dame and left bank which is a lively and charming area. A 25 - 30 minute walk if your up to it through a good area. A bus stop is a half block away near Gare de Lyon train station. We found the bus system and subway a great way to get around once we got familiar with it. The hotel is not noisy even though in close proximity to Gare de Lyon. Transportation to the airport is a snap as Air La France provides a shuttle every 30 min. from the bus stop. Definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “just close to Garede Lyon, no elevator, not quiet,”
Reviews.Author: Vicky6611
Reviews.Content: I paid 99euro for double room one person, but have no tub and very small show room, And the breakfast not worthy for 7.5 Euro The best thing is location .

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay, in an excellent location with a good nights sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Trip-Trapping
Reviews.Content: The Palym Hotel was in a great position a street away from the Gare de Lyon. But despite being in this central location, our sleep was undisturbed. The room was clean, roomy and the bed was gigantic (perhaps an emperors?!). The staff were cordial and all in all, it was a hotel to return to.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: DaleLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a night to go to the Palais de Omnisports at Bercy to see the Masters tennis. Great location. A stroll from the Gare de Lyon, yet not atall noisy even though this beautiful station was in view from our room. A 10 minute walk to the tennis. 5 minutes to the Bastille and the houseboats and art stalls.Clean, comfortable room with vast bed. Basic but good for a 2 star. We did not have a computer with us so could not use wifi. Would have appreciated internet access in reception. But apart from that an excellent stay. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Definitely recommend it and will certainly go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good 2 star but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: BBill49
Reviews.Content: Generally good, clean room & friendly staff. Good location close to Gare de Lyon. Stayed twice in the last 2 months. The first in a quiet room at the back, the second in a room facing Rue Emile Gilbert. This one was noisy because it is close to Gare de Lyon and unusually, wasn't double glazed. I've stayed in about 20 1/2 star hotels in Europe in the last 2 months and this is the first one I've come across that doesn't have it. Very puzzling considering the room location. . .

Reviews.Title: “Yes, you want to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Timetraveler52
Reviews.Content: This is an easy review to write, because it's already been written by others. We were in Paris for a long day and a night for an overnight flight stay and it was my friend's first time in France. I wanted her to have a memorable visit and stay, so I looked for someplace that was well priced, well located, clean and well managed. Scanned TripAdvisor for a good place, looked up a hundred places all over Paris and was impressed with the number of good reviews that a lot of people felt confident enough to write about Hotel Palym. Booked a room through Venere.com because I like their policy of not paying for your reservation until you get to the hotel and you only have to deal with them. Bottom line, I highly recommend Hotel Palym for all the reasons everyone else has already stated and it easily satisfied everything I had expected from this hotel. Couldn't get a better location for transportation to/from airports and around Paris, one of the cleanest rooms I've ever stayed in (not a lot spent on decorations typical of many Paris two-stars, but very comfortable), building is well maintained, elevator is sized for hotel's size, very accomodating staff (had a very early flight and the guy got himself up early and made us coffee to have along with breakfast), good sit-down restaurants and sidewalk cafes just around the corner as well as ethnic hole-in-the-wall cafes on same street, and is situated in a pretty bohemian neighborhood. Price is OK for Paris and the quality of accomodations. Just want to visit Paris and feel comfortable? Yes, you want to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and friendly place to spend a week”
Reviews.Author: easyriderQuebec
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week in this lovely hotel. Our room was located on the rear and was very quiet, no traffic noise. The room was clean and comfortable, the bathroom was extremely clean and modern. Although the room is small compared to North American standards it will do if you are out all day sightseeing as was our case. You can grab a nice breakfast at the local cafés on rue Diderot as this hotel is perfectly located minutes from the Gare de Lyon in the 12th arrondissement of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel near Gare de Lyon”
Reviews.Author: Anne98
Reviews.Content: I found out about this hotel on Trlp Advisor when I was looking for a decent (simple/clean/cheap) hotel near the Gare de Lyon in Paris. Even though it's only rated a 2 star hotel I wasn't disappointed. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. Room on 4th floor was small but contained everything I needed. I didn't eat at the hotel but there is a convenient Monop one block away where I bought all my groceries. (Would have been nice to have a small frig in room). Staff were friendly - some English speaking. Within walking distance to everything I wanted to see. The Air France bus leaves across the street to CDG every half hour. If book hotel on-line will save money (there is a special 3-day deal).

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it. Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Old_Gregg_9
Reviews.Content: Awesome. Wi-fi free via 4 hour cards, but they will give you 2 at once or another one whenever you ask. Breakfast did the job, not bad for 7.5e. Staff friendly and helpful, room more than adequate and quite nice. Across the road from Gare Lyon station so easy to get to other main stations like Gare Nord or the metro. Booked for 3 nights but loved it and ended up staying for 5. 5 nights cost me about 250e for a single - Fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Excellent, pity about the receptionist!”
Reviews.Author: Karna01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Palym for only 3 nights in early June 09. The hotel itself is great, nice clean spacious rooms, small bathroom but you get that. The only thing I could fault this hotel on is the useless day time receptionist, the guys manning reception at night were excellent, highly informative, unfortunately I can't say the same for the girl during the day. Basic requests were way too hard for her, one minute she understands everything you say and the next she doesn't speak English too well...! When working at a hotel you should expect foreigners who don't know much about the city - atleast try and help them, pretend then, don't just walk away with a stupid look on your face. Our stay was great, it's just unfortunate that someone who is suppose to help doesn't, and doesn't even pretend to give a crap.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: WaterMonkey
Reviews.Content: Although not in the heart of things, this small hotel was perfect for what we needed for our 5-night stay and we loved it. The three of us stayed in a triple room that had plenty of room (#32), firm beds and a nice window to the street which was surprisingly not very loud. The ceiling was beautiful and the stairs up and down the floors were nice to look at. The elevator was small but worked great. The Air France airport bus service has a stop one minute away, ditto for the Gare de Lyon subway entrance, and the train station itself is not much further. A bakery is on the other side of the building, or you can get breakfast eats and drinks in the train station for pretty cheap. Nothing beats a warm pain au chocolat and a cappuccino before you hit the streets of Paris! The area was safe at all times for us, as well, so no worries there. Downsides: (a) there's not a tonne of well-known things to do in the area around the hotel. Although the Place de la Bastille is not far, and neither is the Seine, in terms of atmosphere, this area is lacking. It didn't really matter for us but it's worth noting. (b) The breakfast is not worth the money, in my opinion. A quick walk to the yummy bakeries in the area gave me what I needed for almost half the price. (c) The bathtub/shower we had was odd. A shower curtain would have been nice. Note of caution: the one way street outside is always packed with cars so don't expect to get a parking spot, even if it's just to drop stuff off. We rented a car with EuropCar (through AutoEurope) at the CDG airport and later dropped it off at the Gare de Lyon, a great option if you don't want to go back to the airport. I concur with everyone else that driving in Paris is best to be avoided if you want a relaxing stay. I searched Paris high and low online and truly feel I made the right decision for us to stay here. The staff at the front desk were friendly and spoke good English, the room was perfect for our needs, the location was ideal for the transportation we needed, the free wifi was handy, and overall it was a great experience. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, and Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: Hobbitz
Reviews.Content: Hotel Palym is definately the place to stay when in Paris! Service from Reception to Housecleaning was excellent. Everyone seemed to speak very good English. We had a triple room (#42). It was plenty large enough for the 3 of us. The beds were firm and comfortable. The bathroom includes a tub and shower, however the shower only goes as high as 3' (maybe), and does not have a curtain or even a glass wall to keep water off the floor. However, by the 2nd day, you will have figured out the best way to shower with these slightly strange facilities! Free wi-fi in the room was a definite perk. Just be aware that every 3 days or so, you'll need to get a new password from reception. Easy enough. Noise is only a problem from ignorant guests who return in the middle of the night using their "outside" voices in the hallways. Unfortunately, anywhere you stay has these losers! We only had the continental breakfast at the hotel once, choosing to eat at one of the many Brasseries in the area. Breakfast is an extra $7.50 eu / person. If I had to do it again, I would have eaten it more often, as it turned out to be a great time saver and there was plenty to eat, just not a lot of variety of items. Croissants were fresh, what more could you ask for? The hotel is located directly across from the Gare de Lyon station. Whether you want to catch a taxi, bus, metro, or train, it is so easy to do from here. Even if you want to use the Air France shuttle to and from the airport, they all stop at Gare de Lyon. One tip though is to download a map of the metro lines, before you come, and take it with you everywhere! This made taking the metro so much easier and we never ended up in the wrong place! Aside from not being able to stand under the shower head, we have no complaints. No need to worry about booking here!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, well-located place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dn1980dn
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely, clean hotel in a great location. Right opposite the Gare de Lyon (main line and metro) train station only a few seconds walk away (if you take the correct exit). The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Most with good English. Rooms are comfortable and well decorated. Breakfast is basic and not included in the price. There are plenty of eateries nearby. Highly recommended. Would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 3blackjackdavey3
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right beside Gare De Lyon, perfect location for rambling down to the Seinne or catching a Metro or RER around the city. Staff were all very polite and spoke english perfectly. They were great help with tourist information too. They supplied wi-fi cards and adaptor plugs free of charge. Great value for money in Paris, though not very central, all attractions are only a Metro ride away. Rooms were a great size and had a lovely balcony, not a great view but still nice full length window. Bathroom was quite small though. Breakfast was an extra €7 so we avoided that.

Reviews.Title: “Its nice...for the money you pay. Avoid booking through venere.com or easytobook”
Reviews.Author: Real_Vacations
Reviews.Content: Petit room, modernely furnished but with a strange smell, nice staff and good english. Excellent location just 100 meters from Gard du Nord one of the main terminal train stations. Attractions are only a10 min. train ride. Its not worth paying for the breakfast becouse there are plenty of very good and cheap pastry shops just around the corner. Overall, a good value for your money hotel. But definetly avoid booking through venere.com or easytobok.com they will make your vacation a nightmare and your credit card a mess. Very rude and unhelpful staff in case you have a problem during your vacation. TRIPADVISOR RULES!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience at the Palym”
Reviews.Author: taway1
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five - parents + 8 year old + 3 year old twins. This was our first time to Paris and we booked a room with 3 beds through the hotel web site, which said nothing about kids being treated as adults. Several hotels we researched explicitly said something to the effect that kids are welcome/free with adults, so we didn't even think we'd need a 5-bed room (which anyway don't exist in any Paris hotel and a lot of apartments). At checkin, the first thing the lady said was that she wouldn't let us stay there - without even greeting us properly! She very rudely told us that we would have to get separate rooms for the children, no matter that a 3 or 7 year old child cannot stay without his parents! So our welcome to Paris after a long flight from USA was a woman rudely telling us we had no place to stay! She offerred no help as we carried our luggage into their temporary storage while I went looking for rooms at other Paris hotels. She even had the gall to tell us that no more than 3 of us could even _enter_ the room, even for a short time during daytime since the room only had 3 beds (I'm not making this up)! We eventually found another hotel close by that had no problems with letting us all stay in a single room, even though it did not have 5 beds. We split the first night at Palym and this other hotel, and moved out of Palym after the first night. Unfortunately, we went through a lot of pain and wasted a valuable day for the last minute hotel hunt and luggage transfer. I have never seen worse customer orientation than this experience. The lady was rude to us, lied to us and offerred absolutely no help or suggestions at all to someone who was traveling with little kids, with a lot of luggage and clearly new to Paris. I could see the lady was much more friendly to other French speaking customers (and the current rate at which she was booking rooms was much more than the advance reservation rate we'd paid, leading me to wonder if this was a contributing factor). Oh, and the bathroom had yellow spots on the tub and sticky floors!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Palais d'Omnisport”
Reviews.Author: tonxy
Reviews.Content: Stayed a the Hotel Palym whilst visiting Paris to see Coldplay at Bercy. Hotel is clean and decent - room was sufficient with enough space and good sized bathroom. Lift was broken during our stay and we were on 5th floor! Not best when you have travelled all day climbing the stairs with x2 suitcases!! Suppose it was a good warm up for all the walking around Paris!??! Area around the hotel is ok - good transport links. Would stay here again if needed to be near Bercy again for a concert. Not sure I would stay here for a long visit however due to the area around the hotel - not unsafe or bad just there are nicer parts of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location for train station”
Reviews.Author: Getlostinfrance
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night and were very impressed with cleanliness, noise not an issue, maybe because the room faced the courtyard. Rooms recently renovated, small but all you need. Front desk staff were fabulous, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Closest hotel to the Gare De Lyon”
Reviews.Author: TandPToronto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I needed to overnight in Paris to catch a flight back home after a trip to the Cote d'Azur. We took the TGV back from Nice and wanted a place really close to the Gare de Lyon. The Hotel Palym in fact might be the closest place to the Gare de Lyon. It is literally right across from the station on a small street called Emile Gilbert. We paid 81 euros. The breakfast is 7.50 euros and consists of coffee croissants, corn flakes, yogurt, etc, but no cheeses or meats. The room is very, very small but very clean and well kept. The WC is the smallest I have ever seen. It is so small that the toilet seat is on the verge of falling off the toilet because it is so hard to get into a proper seating position without knocking your knees into the wall, so most people must have sat sideways and moved the seat out of its position. There was no room in the shower to put your soap or shampoo. If you hear a squeaky sound it's probably your tush rubbing againt the shower wall (LOL). The front desk staff were very polite and helpful. Overall this place is very convenient for an overnight stay. If you were looking for a place for several days while visiting Paris I would not recommend it. There is no safe or fridge in the room. We chose the Hotel Palym because of the decent reviews given in TripAdvisor.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Palym
HotelInfo.Address: 4, rue Emile Gilbert | 12th Arr., 75012 Paris, France
